runs.comm: starts off with one on the legs, flicked past square leg for a single. That brings the dangerous Jayasuriya on strike.
quite similar to the first delivery, nudged past square leg and they initially think about two but Obanda rushes in from long leg to prevent the second run.

Fullish, on the legs, Tharanga fails to connect with his flick shot and it runs off the pad. Three balls, all on the legs, he has to be really careful with the line. Else, it could disappear over the boundary
further down the leg side
better, much better from Odoyo. In the temptation zone outside off, Jayasuriya has a tentative poke and is beaten
around that off stump again, dabbed to the off side
fullish, hint of movement in, on the middle and off, Jayasuriya leans forward to offer the full face of the bat in defense
from round the stumps, short in length, outside the off stump, the ball holds up a touch and Tharanga is forced to wait on his cut shot and ends up swatting it between cover and mid-off
short and wide, cut over cover point. Mistimed though. The outfield looks pretty slow as well.
swing and a miss. Full, outside off, hint of movement away and Tharanga freed his arms, had a huge swish but no luck
nips in with the angle, towards middle and leg, cramping Tharanga who takes the bottom-hand off the handle and jabs it away
short and drifting towards the leg stump, Jayasuriya needs no further invitation and swivels off the front foot to pull it to long leg boundary
beaten Full and outside off stump, Jayasuriya has a big swing at it but no wood on leather.
on a length, on the middle stump line, strengthens on the middle, defended to the on side
short in length, on the leg and middle, Tharanga shapes to pull but ends up getting in a tangle - cramped up and the ball runs off the pad
short in length again, on the middle and leg, limply pulled towards midwicket
fullish, on the middle and leg, worked to the left of mid-on for a single
Tharanga breaks free with a pull short. Short and on the middle stump line, Tharanga pulls it through wide mid-on

The middle stump has been pegged back. Revenge for Odoyo. Fuller in length, on the middle stump line, straightens a touch and Tharanga went for an ambitious pull shot, missed it completely and heard the death knell. The previous delivery was much shorter and he could unfurl the pull but this was bad shot selection
from round the stumps, short in length,  pulled uppishly to long leg
homing in on the off stump, defended to the on side for a quick single
short in length, outside the off stump and Jayasuriya latches on to it with a fiesty square cut
bangs it in short, it rises chest-high on the middle stump line, it stops a touch on Jayasuriya who helps it towards long leg
Free hit, courtesy the no-ball last delivery and Jayasuriya makes use of it. He backs to the leg-side and thrashes a fullish delivery over mid-on
moves outside leg-side again and chops a short-of-length delivery on the middle stump line to thirdman. One bounce to the fielder.
charges down the track, can't reach the pitch of the length delivery though but still drives it to mid-on
shuffles across to the off stump and misses a length delivery shaving past the leg stump. It must have brushed the thigh pad en route to the 'keeper
Full and outside off, Sanga is beatenm, going for a airy drive
continues to struggle with his timing. Length delivery, on the off stump line, the bat-face shuts as he goes for a drive and the ball rolls to the left of mid-off
jumps out again, Odoyo hurls it down the leg side and Sangakkara gets a tickle with his attempted pick-up shot and it runs down to the fine leg boundary
What was that?  He jumps to a length delivery outside the off stump and tries to heave it across the line. No contact.

Sri Lanka are struggling here. They are trying to slog everything and obviously, missing quite a few. These high-class batsmen don't need to do that. Or do they? Anyway, this one was a length delivery, on the stumps and Jayasuriya jumped out, tried to heave across the line and is beaten
short again but this time Jayasuriya stays back to pull it over midwicket
poor delivery; drifting to the leg side and Jayasuriya helps it to fine leg boundary
very good delivery; yorker from round the stumps, stabbed away
six over backward point. It was a length delivery on the stumps but Jayasuriya gave himself room by moving to leg-side and clubbed it over backward point. Ah! here we go..
retains the strike with a push towards mid-off
fullish, on the middle and leg side, Jayasuriya whips it to long-leg, the fielder gets across in time to stop the ball with his boot
overpitched outside off stump, whacked through covers
short in length and on the stumps, pulled weakly and uppishly towards mid-on but the man is deeper at long-on and can only watch it land safely way in front of him
leans forward to drive a overpitched delivery through extra cover
full in length, on the off stump line, Jayasuriya goes for one mighty slog across the line and the ball brushes the pad to the 'keeper
full-pitched, on the off stump line, Sangakkara scoops it high over mid-on
much better from Sanga. Full-pitched again but this time Sangakkara drives all along the ground, straight past the bowler
full and on the leg and middle line, Sangakkara stays adjacent to the line, drives inside-out towards extra cover
full in length, slanting across Jayasuriya who tires to slog it over midwicket but makes no contact
short in length, on the hips, short-arm pulled it to left of long leg
slipping down the leg side , wide called
full in length, on the stumps, stabbed away with the help of bit of inside edge to short fine leg region

stunning hit. Full-pitched, just outside off stump, Jayasuriya stands still and unfurls a awesome short-arm jab across the line. The ball flew flat and hard over midwicket. Just over the ropes. It was refered upstairs and the confirmation came.
slipping down the leg-side, flicked away to the fine-leg boundary
on a length, on the leg stump, Sangakkara stabs it past square leg
half-volley outside the off stump, drilled through extra cover
lands outside leg stump, on a length, moves towards leg and middle and the ball beats the intended defensive prod and thuds into the pad
on a length, on the legs, flicked to short fine leg
the leg stump has been pegged back. Full and straight on the leg stump line, Sangakkara tries to paddle it away but misses it completely.
full and on the middle stump line, Jayawardene leans forward to work it to midwicket
full and on the stumps, Mahela goes down on his front knee and swings it high over long leg.
drives through the on side for a single
on the off and middle, wristed through midwicket
slower one, full and outside off stump, pushed to right of cover. This is Jayasuriya's second Twenty20 fifty.
length delivery outside off stump, Mahela walks across and tries to lap it square from there and mistimes the shot towards square leg
length delivery, on the stumps, swung right across the line to long leg where Tanmay Mishra makes a mess of a regulation stop
full and on the off stump line, swung over midwicket
slower off cutter, on the middle and off, swept through backward square leg

Dropped by Odoyo and Onyango at deep square leg region. Loopy delivery on the off stump line and Mahela went down on his front knee to lob it high towards deep square leg. Both Odoyo and Onyango rush towards the ball, which meant they were rushing towards each other and collided with each other.
on the leg stump line, paddled away to fine leg boundary
tries to repeat the stroke but makes no contact and the ball rolls off the pad
full, yorker length, jabbed away to midwicket .
fullish, on the leg stump line, swung high and hard towards long leg where the fielder juggled with it - he was dangerously close to the ropes- and pushed it back but his feet had gone over the ropes
lemon cut . Inside edge between the legs to the fine-leg boundary. He went for a swipe across the line to a full-pitched delivery
Free hit and Jayasuriya gets another boundary. Fullish, on the leg and middle, slog-swept past long leg
jumped down the track and short-arm jabbed a pull over square leg. The run-orgy continues
full and outside leg, went for a reverse sweep, misses and that beats the 'keeper
full and on the middle and leg, tickled to fine leg
full and down the legside, Mahela lets it go through
short in length, outside off, cut through backward point. This is getting rather monotonous!
Guess what? Another boundary. Takes it on the full and swings it over midwicket
Yawn... another boundary! Backs to the legside and drives inside-out over extra cover
fullish, driven to long-on
lands outside leg stump, turns in, swept to long leg

backs to the leg-side and drills a full-pitched delivery to extra cover boundary. what a run-fest this has been. Sri Lanka are having a party out there. Wonder whether the song Surangani Surangani .is blaring in Colombo now!
Ah! Jayasuriya is bored with fours and hits a six. In the slot, full and straight, swung high and hard over midwicket
Done in by the slower one. Full and on the middle and leg, Jayasuriya tried to pull it over square leg but instead edges a skier towards mid-on. It has been a brutal knock from Jayasuriya.
full, straight, driven back to the bowler who stretches his right hand out to make a fine stop
full-pitched, on the off and middle, driven to extra cover
length delivery on the off stump line, dabbed to the off side for a single
Innovative. Walks across to the off stump and laps a full toss over short fine leg
He doesn't get it though. Fullish, on the off stump line, driven straight to short extra cover
Gets the second fastest fifty. slower one, top edges a lap shot to right of short fine leg fielder
yorker length, outside off stump, Silva tries to slog-sweep it and misses
Dropped at deep midwicket. Full and on the off and middle, swung to deep midwicket but the fielder rushes in too much and ends up palming it over his head
swept past square leg and Silva attempts to get back for the risky second run but the accurate throw finds him short of the crease
Meanwhile, Mahela continues to have a blast. He backs to the leg-side and drills a full-pitched delivery to the extra cover boundary
very high bouncer outside off stump, Mahela hops up, tries to upper cut but can't reach it
again he backs to the leg-side and whacks a fullish delivery to wide long-off
Three in a row. This is quite an assault from Mahela. HE picks up a slower one early and pulls it wide of deep midwicket
full-pitched, outside off, square driven to deep point
almost yorker length, on the middle stump line, stabbed away to the off side
the slogathon continues. He fetches a full-pitches delivery from outside off and swings it across the line to wide long-on
low dipping full toss, on the middle, dug out towards midwicket
Mahela falls after a whirlwind knock. Full and straight, Mahela fails to connect with his sweep shot and is trapped in front. He hit his second ball for a six and continued to escalate the violence
leans forward to push a length delivery past cover
comes down the track, gets too close to the ball and mistimes a drive to long-on

backs the leg-side in an effort to drive the ball through the off side but the ball lands on a length and hurried straight on to the off stump. Dilshan misses to connect his intended drive and is castled
That's a biggie. Full and on the leg and middle, he clears the front foot and scythes it over long-on
length delivery on the stumps, whacked over deep midwicket. Stand and deliver.
Hattrick six! Mubarak is on fire. He clears the front foot again and smokes a length delivery over long on.
another length delivery, outside the off stump this time, murdered over extra cover
The sixes keep coming. The white ball is flying everywhere. Short in length, on the leg and middle, pulled over deep midwicket
another pull shot but this time straight to deep square leg boundary
Full and on the stumps, Mubarak moves to the leg-side, gives himself room and knives it over extra cover
short in length, outside off stump, slapped over point
Fast and furious. Simple technique: he just clears the front foot out of the line and swings through the line. This time the ball disappears over long-on
gets off the strike with a drive to the on side

No! he doesn't. What a pity. Slower one, outside off stump, Mubarak takes a step or two down the track and tries to heave it over the off side but makes no contact. But take a bow Mubarak. What a fabulous cameo.
